headline: Valero books $1.1 billion impairment, may idle California refinery
summary: The move comes as refiners face growing regulatory and cost pressures in California, the largest U.S. gasoline market, where the state's emissions targets and proposed refinery transparency rules have weighed on long-term investment decisions.  The Benicia converts an average of 145,000 barrels per day (bpd) of crude oil into motor fuels, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration.  "We understand the impact that this may have on our employees, business partners, and community, and will continue to work with them through this period," Lane Riggs, chief executive of San Antonio-based Valero, said on Wednesday.
